intro: Vallesia conzattii, commonly known as the Zambian lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Vallesia conzattii is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its beauty. Its bulbs are also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
